<g1>B4i<x1/><x2/><x3/>iOS<x4/></g1><x5/>B4i is a development tool for native iOS applications.<x6/>B4i follows the same concepts as B4A, allowing you to reuse most of the code and build apps for both Android and iOS.<x7/>

<g1>B4i<x1/><x2/><x3/>iOS<x4/></g1><x5/>B4i is a development tool for native iOS applications.<x6/>B4i follows the same concepts as B4A, allowing you to reuse most of the code and build apps for both Android and iOS.<x7/>

<g1>B4J<x1/><x2/><x3/>Java / Windows / Mac / Linux / Raspberry PI<x4/></g1><x5/>B4J is a <g2>100% free</g2> development tool for desktop, server and IoT solutions.<x6/>With B4J you can easily create desktop applications (UI), console programs (non-UI) and server solutions.<x7/>The compiled apps can run on Windows, Mac, Linux and ARM boards (such as Raspberry Pi).<x8/>

<g1>B4J<x1/><x2/><x3/>Java / Windows / Mac / Linux / Raspberry PI<x4/></g1><x5/>B4J is a <g2>100% free</g2> development tool for desktop, server and IoT solutions.<x6/>With B4J you can easily create desktop applications (UI), console programs (non-UI) and server solutions.<x7/>The compiled apps can run on Windows, Mac, Linux and ARM boards (such as Raspberry Pi).<x8/>

<g1>B4R<x1/><x2/> <x3/>Arduino / ESP8266<x4/></g1><g2>B4R is a <g3>100% free</g3></g2> development tool for native Arduino and ESP8266 programs.<x5/>B4R follows the same concepts of the other B4X tools, providing a simple and powerful development tool.<x6/>B4R, B4A, B4J and B4i together make the best development solution for the Internet of Things (IoT).<x7/>

<g1>B4R<x1/><x2/> <x3/>Arduino / ESP8266<x4/></g1><g2>B4R is a <g3>100% free</g3></g2> development tool for native Arduino and ESP8266 programs.<x5/>B4R follows the same concepts of the other B4X tools, providing a simple and powerful development tool.<x6/>B4R, B4A, B4J and B4i together make the best development solution for the Internet of Things (IoT).<x7/>

<g1>B4XPages<x1/></g1><x2/>B4XPages is an internal library for B4A, B4i and B4J allowing to develop easily cross-platform programs.<x3/>B4XPages is explained in detail in the B4XPages Cross-platform projects booklet.<x4/>Even, if you want to develop only in one platform it is interesting to use the B4XPages library it makes the program flow simpler especially for B4A.

<g1>B4A (Basic for Android) is a simple yet powerful development environment that targets Android devices.</g1><x1/>B4A language is similar to Visual Basic language with additional support for objects.<x2/>B4A compiled applications are native Android applications; there are no extra runtimes or dependencies.<x3/>Unlike other IDE’s, B4A is 100% focused on Android development.<x4/>B4A includes a powerful <g2>GUI designer</g2> with built-in support for multiple screens and orientations.
